column9: Abilify is used to eliminate overwheming sadness and comes in a dissolveable tablet form.

column2: pjays20, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: As a Bipolar,known to be a "rapid Cycler" Found this to be my personal savior. I have been on the following: Risperdal, Zyprexa, Effexor, Lithium, Depokote and Klonopin with very little results. A 10mg dose finally worked to my satisfaction and I feel much more stable. Please note I am now using Lamictal (30mgs), Geodon (80mgs), Abilify (10mgs) with 2 sleepaids (Trazadone and Ambien). I am concerned about weight  gain however.

column2: Physcho, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a terrible expierence with the use of this medication that landed me in the hospital. It actually brought on a serious manic attack when used as a mania prohibitor. My expierence included a massive mania attack, blindness, hallucinations, and the such. Normally I have an extremely high tolerance for all levels of prescription medications, but in this case I would recommend caution and awareness when using to treat bipolar mania..

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Having schizophrenia- I was on Risperdal for a year and a half and it made me gain 30 pounds.  I take Abilify for five years and I am able to work full-time, completed my Bachelors Degree, and raise a child successfully. Keep positive and you too can be successful.

column2: aclark27, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Being recently diagnosed, this is the first medication for this disorder that I have taken. My doctor prescribed the 30mg tablets right off the bat, and found that After taking it the first day, I found that it rendered me completely useless. Being a  single mom of 3 very young kids, it's imperative that I make it to work , and when I took this it zapped my energy so much that I couldn;t even get out of bed. I broke out in a rash and also began hallucinating. After ta king this for one more day, and getting the same result, i stopped the Abilify. I don't feel I would take it again.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: Charles, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I am a caregive for someone that 18 and  takes this medication who has a variety of issues including epileptic seizures. This medication seems to be working for his bi-polar disorder, but has increased his seizuers.

I am either about ready to fall asleep or I can clean the house in 15 minutes. It also makes me very agitated and irritable and downright angry. Of course I just paid for my script. Why so expensive? I am only on 4mg.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: ellisu06, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: DO NOT TAKE WITH EXCEDRIN BACK AND BODY!!! It made me so weak and shaky.. it was horrible! Everytime I had caffeine it did the same thing.I took it for a little over a week. The first time I took it I felt drunk. After, it made me weak, gave me very blurry vision, tunnel vision, and made me shaky, which was made worse by the Prozac I took with it for the first few days, but really got bad when I took the excedrin b&b... This drug is just too new.

column2: Babs, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After taking this med for 1 1/2 weeks, along with my other depression meds, I lost 2 days of my life.  Totalled my car, and was totally as the neurologist said in an "altered state".  Don't know if it was the ability, but I had an MRI, sonograms of carodid artery and heart, tons of blood tests, memory test, eeg.  They found nothing wrong with me.  The only change during that time is taking abilify.  I am 63 with long standing depression, and do not have dementia. They have no idea what caused the problem.  Possibily the Abilify?!

column9: While taking this drug, my blood sugar spiked to 370 and I am now having to take medication to control my diabetes.  I have no idea if coming off of it will reverse my diabetes but I would be cautious and talk to your doctor about potential side effects.

column9: When I took this in April 2010 I had horrible side effects, sweating, and throwing up.

column2: ocdgirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have severe obsessive compulsive disorder. I had been on Lexapro, AND I was doing well after 2 years I went off it. I was doing well for a few months, and then my OCD spiraled out of control. I started taking Lexapro again 3 weeks ago. Last week I was still doing horribly. My Psychiatrist put me on 2 MG of Abilify and it seemed to kick in for me the next day. I'm not perfect, but my OCD thoughts are much less. I'm not ruminating. I don't have rituals, just obsessive thoughts. They're practically gone in one week. This medicine seems to have done the trick for me thus far. I have just started CBT therapy too. My appetite has increased. I don't know if it's actually from the Abilify.
